name: RatingGauge
classdesc:
JET Rating Gauge

Rating gauges are typically used to display or accept user feedback on a product or service. 
<oj-c-rating-gauge value='4'></oj-c-rating-gauge>

Accessibility

The application is required to set one of the following attributes on the element with meaningful descriptors as the rating-gauge element does not provide a default descriptor.

  • aria-label
  • aria-labelledby
  • aria-describedby

If the application is using readonly, thresholds or reference lines to provide additional context, they need to include such information for screender readers using either of the following methods:

  • aria-describedby
  • aria-labelledby
  • aria-label
  • datatip

Disabled content: JET supports an accessible luminosity contrast ratio, as specified in WCAG 2.0 - Section 1.4.3 "Contrast", in the themes that are accessible. (See the "Theming" chapter of the JET Developer Guide for more information on which themes are accessible.) Note that Section 1.4.3 says that text or images of text that are part of an inactive user interface component have no contrast requirement. Because disabled content may not meet the minimum contrast ratio required of enabled content, it cannot be used to convey meaningful information.

Keyboard

Key Action
Enter Submit the current value of the gauge.
Tab Move focus to next element and submit the current value of the gauge.
Shift + Tab Move focus to previous element.
End Increase the gauge's transient value to max value. Value is set after using Enter or Tab to submit.
Home Decrease the gauge's transient value to zero. Value is set after using Enter or Tab to submit.
LeftArrow Decrease the gauge's transient value in left-to-right locales. Increase the gauge's transient value in right-to-left locales. Value is set after using Enter or Tab to submit.
RightArrow Increase the gauge's transient value in left-to-right locales. Decrease the gauge's transient value in right-to-left locales. Value is set after using Enter or Tab to submit.

Touch End User Information

Gesture Action
Drag Value change when readonly or disabled is false.

name: max
description: Integer value specifying the maximum value of the gauge, which determines the number of items that are displayed.

name: readonly
description: Defines whether the value of the gauge can be changed by the end user.

name: disabled
description: Defines whether the gauge is disabled or not. User interaction is prevented and the rating gauge is hidden from screen readers if set to true.

name: changed
description: Whether there has been a value entered by the user even if it is the same as the initial value.

name: value
description:
The value of the Rating Gauge. The element's value attribute is used if it
is provided, otherwise the default value of 0 is used.
Any other negative value will default to 0.

name: step
description: Specifies the increment by which values can be changed by the end user.

name: describedBy
description:
Used to establish a relationship between this component and another element.
A common use is to tie a label, which can be a text in a div or some other HTML element, and the oj-c-rating-gauge together for accessibility.
The oj-label element has a label-id, which is used by the described-by attribute to tie the two components together to facilitate correct screen reader behavior.

name: labelledBy
description:
Used to establish a relationship between this component and another element.
A common use is to tie a label, which can be a text in a div or some other HTML element, and the oj-c-rating-gauge together for accessibility.
The oj-label element has a label-id, which is used by the labelled-by attribute to tie the two components together to facilitate correct screen reader behavior.

name: size
description: Specifies the size of the individual rating gauge items.

name: color
description: Specifies the color of the individual rating gauge items.

ojvalues.name: neutral
ojvalues.description: neutral color Rating Gauge (default, if unspecified)

name: thresholds
description: An array of objects defining the thresholds for the rating gauge.

name: datatip
description: The rating gauge datatip string. Datatip is only used for interactive rating gauges.

name: tooltip
description: The rating gauge tooltip. Tooltip is only used for read only rating gauges. If aria-label is not specified, tooltip will be used as the aria-label.

name: transientValue
description: A read-only property for retrieving the transient value from the rating gauge. It is updated upon user gestures that cause transient value changes, such as hovering over the rating gauge.

name: setProperty
description: Sets a property or a single subproperty for complex properties and notifies the component of the change, triggering a corresponding event.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to set. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

params.name: value
params.description: The new value to set the property to.

name: getProperty
description: Retrieves the value of a property or a subproperty.

params.name: property
params.description: The property name to get. Supports dot notation for subproperty access.

name: setProperties
description: Performs a batch set of properties.

params.name: properties
params.description: An object containing the property and value pairs to set.

name: touchDoc
description:
Gesture Action
Drag Value change when readonly or disabled is false.

properties.name: accessibleLabel
properties.description: A label for the threshold used for accessibility purposes.

properties.name: color
properties.description:
The color of the threshold.

In addition to standard CSS color values, special enumerated values 'danger', 'warning', and 'success' are also supported. These special values are mapped to corresponding CSS color values based upon the current theme.

ojvalues.name: danger
ojvalues.description: Maps to theme-specific color indicating a danger condition

ojvalues.name: warning
ojvalues.description: Maps to theme-specific color indicating a warning condition

ojvalues.name: success
ojvalues.description: Maps to theme-specific color indicating a success condition

properties.name: max
properties.description: The maximum value of the threshold.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the currently active rating gauge item.
